transformed_representation: Chris Evert was on a streak of 13 tournament wins and had not lost a match on clay that year. She won her first Grand Slam title in Paris and would go on to have an illustrious career, winning 18 major titles and holding the number one ranking for 260 weeks.

Bjorn Borg's victory marked the beginning of his reign as one of the greatest tennis players of all time. He would win six more French Open titles, five consecutive Wimbledon titles, and a total of 11 Grand Slam titles before retiring in 1981 at the age of 26.
llm_output:
This article is about the finals of the French Open (Roland-Garros) in 1974. In the women's singles final, Chris Evert defeated Olga Morozova 6-1, 6-2. In the men's singles final, Bjorn Borg defeated Manuel Orantes 2-6, 6-3, 6-3, 6-0 to become the youngest man to win Roland-Garros at the time.

Chris Evert was on a streak of 13 tournament wins and had not lost a match on clay that year. She won her first Grand Slam title in Paris and would go on to have an illustrious career, winning 18 major titles and holding the number one ranking for 260 weeks.

Bjorn Borg's victory marked the beginning of his reign as one of the greatest tennis players of all time. He would win six more French Open titles, five consecutive Wimbledon titles, and a total of 11 Grand Slam titles before retiring in 1981 at the age of 26.
